title: Bats bat-tered by wind turbines
lead: Common pipistrelle bats are attracted to spinning turbines and can then get maimed or killed

title: US airline orders flying e-taxis for airport pickups
lead: The electric air taxis are expected to start flights in the next five years

title: Consultation on green spaceflight from British soil lifts off
lead: Government seeks views on the environmental impact of spaceflight

title: Honey, I blew up the wind turbine
lead: Vestas has launched a 15MW offshore wind turbine with a 236-metre rotor

title: Research investigates the shady role of wind turbines
lead: Objective to see if shadows cast by wind turbines affect the performance of solar parks

title: EMEC to explore floating wind and hydrogen opportunities in Scotland and France
lead: Research will be carried out to understand the technical status of floating wind and hydrogen in the two countries and identify ways collaboration can be encouraged

title: Only 28% of Brits have heard of heat networks
lead: Of those who were aware of them, just over half were positive towards heat networks, new report shows

title: Equinor to sell US Bakken shale assets in $900m deal
lead: The deal covers all of Equinor’s operated and non-operated acreage in the Bakken, located in the states of North Dakota and Montana, which will be sold to Grayson Mill Energy

title: Iberdrola seeks innovative solutions to decarbonise industrial sector
lead: It is looking for ad-hoc solutions for factories, such as improving the efficiency of the energy used while reducing carbon emissions ‘in a sustainable and cost-effective manner’

title: MPs warn of air pollution’s deadliness and impact on the disadvantaged
lead: Parliamentary Committee urges the government to put the improvement of air quality ‘at core’ of the post-pandemic rebuild
